intro: Hymenocallis declinata, commonly known as the Mexican white yarrow, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, showy white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and has strap-shaped leaves that are often arranged in a basal rosette. Its flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hymenocallis declinata is valued in horticulture for its ornamental beauty and ability to thrive in a variety of garden settings.
